hero.title: Commit messages,
hero.sub: A minimal, deterministic commit standard that replaces noise with signal. Built for teams. Designed to last.

format.label: The Format
format.title: One structure.
format.sub: Three components. No colons, parentheses, or mandatory footers. Just clarity.

type.name: Type
type.desc: A 3-letter capitalized identifier describing the intent. Add, Fix, Ref and more.

bang.desc: Appended after Type. Signals a breaking change. Maps to SemVer MAJOR regardless of base type.

scope.name: scope
scope.desc: Lowercase domain identifier — where the change lives. ui, api, db, auth.

description.name: description
description.desc: Lowercase, concise, human-readable. No trailing period. Write for someone scanning git log at speed.

types.label: Types
types.title: Every commit
types.sub: Core Types are mandatory for compliance. Extended Types are officially defined — opt in when your team benefits.

semver.label: SemVer Mapping
semver.title: Automation-ready
semver.sub: Every commit maps deterministically to a semantic version impact. No context. No guessing. Tooling reads it directly.

rows.internal: No version bump unless ! is used

validation.label: Validation
validation.title: One regex.
validation.sub: The normative pattern for OpenCommits v1.0.0. Defines the complete grammar of a valid subject line. Drop it into any linter.
validation.defaultLabel: Default profile — allows up to two scope tokens

cta.title: Start using it
cta.sub: Read the full specification, contribute to the standard, or drop the regex into your CI pipeline right now.

spec.title: OpenCommits v1.0.0 Specification
spec.description: The complete OpenCommits v1.0.0 commit message standard specification.

meta.title: Git Commit Messages Standard | OpenCommits
meta.description: OpenCommits is a git commit standard for clean, deterministic commit messages with built-in SemVer mapping and CI-ready validation.
